testCases.title: QA Form Display and Navigation
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality of accessing and navigating the Quality Assurance form interface, including form loading and field display.
testCases.expectedResult: The QA form should be accessible and display all relevant fields for quality assessment.

steps.stepDescription: Login to the system with supervisor credentials.
steps.expectedResult: User should be successfully logged in with supervisor privileges.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the QA section or locate QA menu option.
steps.expectedResult: QA section or menu should be accessible to supervisor users.

steps.stepDescription: Access the call listing for QA purposes.
steps.expectedResult: Call listing page should display with calls available for QA assessment.

steps.stepDescription: Select a call from the listing to perform QA.
steps.expectedResult: Selected call details should be presented.

steps.stepDescription: Initiate the QA assessment process for the selected call.
steps.expectedResult: QA form should open with all required fields and sections.

steps.stepDescription: Verify all required QA categories and criteria are present.
steps.expectedResult: All QA assessment categories and criteria should be displayed according to the QA template.

steps.stepDescription: Check for presence of scoring options for each criterion.
steps.expectedResult: Each criterion should have appropriate scoring options (e.g., rating scale, yes/no).

steps.stepDescription: Verify comment fields are available for providing feedback.
steps.expectedResult: Comment fields should be present for adding assessment feedback.

steps.stepDescription: Verify audio player is present in the QA form.
steps.expectedResult: Audio player should be displayed for the selected call recording.

steps.stepDescription: Verify navigation options within the QA form.
steps.expectedResult: Form should have clear navigation controls (save, submit, cancel, etc.).

testCases.title: QA Form Audio Player Functionality
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality of the audio player within the QA form, including playback controls and audio quality.
testCases.expectedResult: The audio player should load the correct call recording and provide functional playback controls.

steps.stepDescription: Access the QA form for a specific call.
steps.expectedResult: QA form should open with audio player component visible.

steps.stepDescription: Verify the audio player automatically loads the correct call recording.
steps.expectedResult: Audio player should display with the correct call recording loaded.

steps.stepDescription: Test the play button on the audio player.
steps.expectedResult: Recording should begin playing when play button is clicked.

steps.stepDescription: Test the pause button on the audio player.
steps.expectedResult: Recording should pause when pause button is clicked.

steps.stepDescription: Test the rewind or seek backward function.
steps.expectedResult: Recording should rewind to an earlier point in the call.

steps.stepDescription: Test the fast forward or seek forward function if available.
steps.expectedResult: Recording should advance to a later point in the call.

steps.stepDescription: Test the volume control if available.
steps.expectedResult: Audio volume should adjust according to volume control changes.

steps.stepDescription: Test the playback progress indicator.
steps.expectedResult: Progress indicator should accurately reflect current position in the recording.

steps.stepDescription: Verify audio quality of the recording.
steps.expectedResult: Audio should be clear and of sufficient quality for assessment purposes.

steps.stepDescription: Test clicking on different points in the progress bar if available.
steps.expectedResult: Playback should jump to the selected position in the recording.

testCases.title: QA Assessment Scoring
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality of scoring call quality using the various criteria and point systems in the QA form.
testCases.expectedResult: QA scoring functionality should work correctly, allowing supervisors to assign scores and calculate total results.

steps.stepDescription: Access the QA form for a specific call.
steps.expectedResult: QA form should open with scoring criteria displayed.

steps.stepDescription: Identify all scoring categories available in the form.
steps.expectedResult: All required QA categories should be present with their respective criteria.

steps.stepDescription: Test assigning scores to individual criteria within the first category.
steps.expectedResult: Scores should be accepted and reflected in the form for each criterion.

steps.stepDescription: Verify category subtotal calculation if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: Category subtotal should update based on individual criterion scores.

steps.stepDescription: Complete scoring for all categories in the QA form.
steps.expectedResult: All categories should accept scores without errors.

steps.stepDescription: Verify total QA score calculation.
steps.expectedResult: Total QA score should be calculated correctly as the sum of all category scores.

steps.stepDescription: Test entering scores outside the acceptable range if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: System should prevent or warn about invalid score entries.

steps.stepDescription: Test N/A or Not Applicable options if available.
steps.expectedResult: N/A selections should be handled correctly in score calculations.

steps.stepDescription: Test scoring field validation for required fields.
steps.expectedResult: System should enforce required scoring fields before submission.

steps.stepDescription: Verify score percentage calculation if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: Score percentage should be calculated correctly based on points awarded vs. total possible points.

testCases.title: QA Assessment Comments and Feedback
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to add comments and feedback to QA assessments.
testCases.expectedResult: Supervisors should be able to add detailed comments and feedback that are properly saved with the assessment.

steps.stepDescription: Access the QA form for a specific call.
steps.expectedResult: QA form should open with comment fields available.

steps.stepDescription: Identify all comment fields available in the form.
steps.expectedResult: Comment fields should be present at both category and overall assessment levels.

steps.stepDescription: Test entering a short comment in a category-level comment field.
steps.expectedResult: Comment should be accepted and displayed in the field.

steps.stepDescription: Test entering a longer comment with special characters.
steps.expectedResult: Longer comments and special characters should be handled correctly.

steps.stepDescription: Test character limits on comment fields if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: System should enforce character limits and provide feedback when exceeded.

steps.stepDescription: Enter comments in all available comment fields throughout the assessment.
steps.expectedResult: All comment fields should accept input without errors.

steps.stepDescription: Test entering constructive feedback in the overall assessment comment field.
steps.expectedResult: Overall feedback should be accepted and displayed appropriately.

steps.stepDescription: Verify comment field validation for required comment fields if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: System should enforce required comment fields before submission.

steps.stepDescription: Test rich text formatting if supported (bold, italics, etc.).
steps.expectedResult: Rich text formatting should be applied correctly in comment fields if supported.

steps.stepDescription: Verify comments are preserved when navigating between sections of the form.
steps.expectedResult: Comments should persist when navigating between different parts of the assessment form.

testCases.title: QA Form Submission and Saving
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to save and submit completed QA assessments.
testCases.expectedResult: QA assessments should be successfully saved and submitted with all scores and comments preserved.

steps.stepDescription: Complete a QA assessment with scores and comments.
steps.expectedResult: QA form should be filled with valid scores and comments.

steps.stepDescription: Test the Save function if available (for saving work in progress).
steps.expectedResult: Assessment should save successfully with confirmation message.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate away from the saved assessment and return to verify data persistence.
steps.expectedResult: Previously saved data should be preserved and displayed correctly upon return.

steps.stepDescription: Test the Submit function to finalize the assessment.
steps.expectedResult: Assessment should submit successfully with confirmation message.

steps.stepDescription: Test submission with incomplete required fields.
steps.expectedResult: System should prevent submission and highlight missing required fields.

steps.stepDescription: Test submission with invalid data entry.
steps.expectedResult: System should prevent submission and provide error messages for invalid data.

steps.stepDescription: Verify the submitted assessment appears in the completed assessments list.
steps.expectedResult: Completed assessment should be visible in the appropriate listing with correct status.

steps.stepDescription: Test cancellation of an assessment in progress.
steps.expectedResult: System should prompt for confirmation before discarding unsaved changes.

steps.stepDescription: Test auto-save functionality if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: System should automatically save assessment data at specified intervals.

steps.stepDescription: Verify notification or confirmation of successful submission.
steps.expectedResult: User should receive clear confirmation that submission was successful.

testCases.title: QA Call Search and Filtering
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to search and filter calls for quality assessment.
testCases.expectedResult: Supervisors should be able to effectively search and filter the call listing to find specific calls for QA.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the call listing for QA purposes.
steps.expectedResult: Call listing page should load with search and filter options visible.

steps.stepDescription: Identify all available search fields and filters.
steps.expectedResult: Search fields should include date, agent, phone number, disposition, etc.

steps.stepDescription: Test searching for calls by date range.
steps.expectedResult: System should return calls within the specified date range.

steps.stepDescription: Test searching for calls by specific agent or extension.
steps.expectedResult: System should return calls handled by the specified agent/extension.

steps.stepDescription: Test searching for calls by phone number.
steps.expectedResult: System should return calls with the specified phone number.

steps.stepDescription: Test filtering calls by disposition status (answered, missed, etc.).
steps.expectedResult: System should filter calls by the selected disposition status.

steps.stepDescription: Test filtering calls by call duration.
steps.expectedResult: System should filter calls by the specified duration range.

steps.stepDescription: Test filtering calls by QA status (assessed, not assessed).
steps.expectedResult: System should filter calls by their QA assessment status.

steps.stepDescription: Test combining multiple search criteria.
steps.expectedResult: System should return only calls matching all specified criteria.

steps.stepDescription: Verify search result display and sorting options.
steps.expectedResult: Search results should be clearly displayed with relevant call information and sorting options.

testCases.title: QA Results Viewing
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to view completed QA assessment results.
testCases.expectedResult: Completed QA assessments should be accessible with all scores, comments, and details correctly displayed.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the QA results or completed assessments section.
steps.expectedResult: QA results listing should load with completed assessments visible.

steps.stepDescription: Identify search and filter options for finding specific assessments.
steps.expectedResult: Search and filter options should be available for navigating assessment results.

steps.stepDescription: Select a completed assessment to view its details.
steps.expectedResult: Assessment details should open with complete information displayed.

steps.stepDescription: Verify all scoring categories and individual criteria scores are displayed.
steps.expectedResult: All scores should be visible with their respective categories and criteria.

steps.stepDescription: Verify all comments and feedback are displayed.
steps.expectedResult: All comments and feedback should be visible in their respective sections.

steps.stepDescription: Verify total score and score percentage are displayed.
steps.expectedResult: Total score and percentage should be displayed and calculated correctly.

steps.stepDescription: Verify assessment metadata is displayed (date, time, assessor, agent).
steps.expectedResult: Metadata should be displayed accurately for the assessment.

steps.stepDescription: Test the audio playback capability within the results view if available.
steps.expectedResult: Call recording should be playable from the assessment results view.

steps.stepDescription: Test printing or exporting the assessment results if available.
steps.expectedResult: Assessment results should print or export correctly with all information included.

steps.stepDescription: Verify access controls for viewing assessment results.
steps.expectedResult: Assessment results should only be viewable by authorized users.

testCases.title: QA Results Reporting
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to generate and view reports based on QA assessment data.
testCases.expectedResult: QA reports should accurately compile and present assessment data for analysis and review.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the QA reporting section.
steps.expectedResult: QA reporting interface should load with report options visible.

steps.stepDescription: Identify available report types and formats.
steps.expectedResult: Different report types should be available (agent performance, team performance, etc.).

steps.stepDescription: Select and generate an individual agent performance report.
steps.expectedResult: Agent performance report should generate with QA scores and metrics.

steps.stepDescription: Verify the report contains accurate agent assessment data.
steps.expectedResult: Report should display correct QA scores and assessment counts for the agent.

steps.stepDescription: Select and generate a team or department performance report.
steps.expectedResult: Team report should generate with aggregated QA data for multiple agents.

steps.stepDescription: Test filtering report data by date range.
steps.expectedResult: Report should update to show only data from the specified date range.

steps.stepDescription: Test filtering report data by assessment criteria or categories.
steps.expectedResult: Report should filter to show performance in selected criteria or categories.

steps.stepDescription: Verify trend analysis or comparison reports if available.
steps.expectedResult: Trend reports should show QA performance changes over time.

steps.stepDescription: Test exporting report data in different formats (Excel, PDF, etc.).
steps.expectedResult: Reports should export correctly in the selected format with all data preserved.

steps.stepDescription: Verify visualization options for report data (charts, graphs).
steps.expectedResult: Visual representations of report data should display accurately.

testCases.title: QA Assessment Modification
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to edit or modify existing QA assessments if allowed.
testCases.expectedResult: Authorized users should be able to modify QA assessments with changes properly saved and tracked.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the completed QA assessments listing.
steps.expectedResult: Completed assessments listing should load.

steps.stepDescription: Select a completed assessment and attempt to access edit mode.
steps.expectedResult: Edit option should be available for authorized users within the allowed timeframe.

steps.stepDescription: Verify edit permissions and restrictions.
steps.expectedResult: System should enforce edit permissions based on user role and assessment status.

steps.stepDescription: Modify scores for several criteria in the assessment.
steps.expectedResult: Score modifications should be accepted in edit mode.

steps.stepDescription: Modify comments in several sections of the assessment.
steps.expectedResult: Comment modifications should be accepted in edit mode.

steps.stepDescription: Save the modified assessment.
steps.expectedResult: Modified assessment should save successfully with confirmation message.

steps.stepDescription: Verify total score and percentage recalculation after modifications.
steps.expectedResult: Total score and percentage should update based on the modified individual scores.

steps.stepDescription: Verify audit trail or modification history if available.
steps.expectedResult: System should track and display who made changes and when.

steps.stepDescription: Test modification time limits if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: System should enforce time limits on how long after submission an assessment can be modified.

steps.stepDescription: Verify notification of assessment modifications if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: Relevant users should be notified when an assessment is modified.

testCases.title: QA Template Management
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to manage QA assessment templates if available.
testCases.expectedResult: QA templates should be effectively created, modified, and applied to assessments.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the QA template management section if available.
steps.expectedResult: QA template management interface should load.

steps.stepDescription: Review existing assessment templates.
steps.expectedResult: Existing templates should be listed with names and descriptions.

steps.stepDescription: Access the template creation function if available.
steps.expectedResult: Template creation interface should load with necessary fields.

steps.stepDescription: Create a new assessment category within a template.
steps.expectedResult: New category should be added successfully to the template.

steps.stepDescription: Add assessment criteria to the new category.
steps.expectedResult: New criteria should be added with point values and descriptions.

steps.stepDescription: Save the modified or new template.
steps.expectedResult: Template should save successfully and appear in the template list.

steps.stepDescription: Test template activation/deactivation if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: Template activation status should change as expected.

steps.stepDescription: Test assigning templates to specific call types or departments.
steps.expectedResult: Templates should be assignable to specific areas or call types.

steps.stepDescription: Verify template versioning if supported.
steps.expectedResult: Template versions should be tracked with change history.

steps.stepDescription: Test using the newly created/modified template for an assessment.
steps.expectedResult: New/modified template should be available and function correctly during assessment.
